column4: New one question:  does ubuntu 8.04 supports wireless? I have advent 7204 laptop.
it supports wireless. However, not all drivers can be supported or distributed.
i'm on windows only becouse i cant connect to internet using linux.
doesn't work, isn't working, etc, doesn't mean anything. If you go to a doctor, you wouldn't say, "I don't work properly, what's wrong?". You'd explain your symptoms.
it tries connect, but it stucks
are you able to connect to the wlan using another pc or another operating system on the same machine?
the same pc on windows
what kind of encryption does the network use?
wep (hex) wpa psk
if you disable encryption on the router, does it work?
i have not tried or i do not remember
How can I disable encryption?
depends on your router.
I have speedtouch thomson st585 v6
sorry. It's outside the scope of the channel, and you'd probably figure it out way faster than I could, since I don't have access.
somewhere in your routers configuration webapp, there should be an option to choose encryption method. It should also provide a "no encryption" option.
Would be VNC enought?
or something similar.
that would have made it technically possible, but I don't have the time. I'm sure you will figure it out. Read your routers manual, or just explore it's interface. Have you used it before?
OK. Thanks again, I will try when I have Ubuntu installed.
good luck, and have fun :)
